DOC.brief_summary: ABSTRACT Background : More two third sudden cardiac arrest witness bystander . Bystander cardiopulmonary resuscitation ( CPR ) double survival cardiac arrest . Importantly , even witness cardiac arrest 20 % bystander commence basic life support . Common reason commence include panic perceive inability perform CPR correctly . A meta-analysis could demonstrate simplification algorithm ( compression-only dispatcher-assisted bystander CPR ) lead 22 % increase survival-to-hospital discharge . A recently publish trial research group could demonstrate presence flowchart positive effect quality BLS time increase rescuer ' confidence . Nonetheless , perform CPR exhaust . Previous publication emphasize increase fatigue duration CPR effort , standard chest compressions-only CPR . Consequently , want test hypothesis chest compression ( CC ) deliver correctly regard depth utilize standard BLS algorithm aid flowchart compare CC algorithm utilize adapt CPR flowchart manikin resuscitation model . Methods : After consent Research Ethics Board Medical University Vienna obtain write informed consent participant , 84 medically untrained layperson randomise perform flow-chart assist CPR 300s follow standard CPR guideline CC CPR . The primary outcome parameter total number CC achieve correct depth 50-60mm . Secondary outcome parameter hands-off time , total number CC , compression rate . The total number deliver rescue breath , tidal volume , time deliver also evaluate . Furthermore , subjective point exhaustion affect CPR quality , reason discontinuation CPR stop within 300sec . period exhaustion end CPR measure evaluate .
DOC.brief_title: Flowchart-Assisted Resuscitation . Standard CPR v . Chest Compressions Only : What Happened Quality ?
DOC.detailed_description: Study Design The investigation conduct prospective , randomize control study perform Department Anaesthesia , General Intensive Care Pain Management , Medical University Vienna , Austria , accord Good Scientific Practise guideline Medical University Vienna . The data collection conduct cooperation Training Centre St. John Ambulance , Vienna , Austria . Study Population Eligible volunteer ≥18 year age non-medical profession , irrespective gender . Exclusion criteria professional medical training ( nurse , medical doctor , physiotherapist , ergotherepeuts , emergency medical technician equivalent ) , pregnancy ( verbal response time recruitment ) , parallel participation clinical trial , physical impairment illness prohibit physical effort . If participant choses abort resuscitation attempt open end question `` Why discontinue resuscitation attempt ? '' raise . All test p-values two-sided p≤0.05 regard statistically significant . Students t-test chi-sqare test use appropriate .
